intro: Kadua arnottii, commonly known as the Kauai ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its strong, woody structure and is often found growing in coastal and lowland habitats. Kadua arnottii plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for native wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
